payload.instructions:
# Hearthlink Agent Team Manifest

This document defines the structure of the specialized AI agent team for the Hearthlink project. Each agent has a distinct role and is configured with a specific skill prompt from the `.claude/skills/` directory.

## Core Development Team

### 1. Specifications Planner
- **Role:** Gathers requirements, defines project scope, and produces detailed technical specifications (PRDs).
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/project-planner.md](./.claude/skills/project-planner.md)

### 2. System Architect
- **Role:** Designs the overall system architecture, including security, performance, and database structure.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/system-architect.md](./.claude/skills/system-architect.md)

### 3. Agent Architect
- **Role:** Specializes in the design of the multi-agent ecosystem, communication, and coordination.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/agent-architect.md](./.claude/skills/agent-architect.md)

### 4. Frontend Developer
- **Role:** Implements the UI/UX in React/TypeScript, focusing on accessibility and performance.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-frontend-dev.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-frontend-dev.md)

### 5. Backend Developer
- **Role:** Implements the core services and IPC architecture in Rust/Tauri.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-backend-dev.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-backend-dev.md)

## Specialist & Support Roles

### 6. UI/UX Design Specialist
- **Role:** Focuses on visual design, motion, and creating polished, intuitive interfaces.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-ui-ux-designer.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-ui-ux-designer.md)

### 7. DevOps Engineer
- **Role:** Manages CI/CD pipelines, build automation, and infrastructure.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/devops-engineer.md](./.claude/skills/devops-engineer.md)

### 8. Accessibility Specialist
- **Role:** Audits for WCAG compliance and ensures the application is inclusive.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/accessibility-specialist.md](./.claude/skills/accessibility-specialist.md)

### 9. Voice Integration Specialist
- **Role:** Designs and implements voice interfaces, speech recognition, and TTS.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/voice-integration-specialist.md](./.claude/skills/voice-integration-specialist.md)

### 10. Quality Validator (Code Reviewer)
- **Role:** Ensures code quality, test coverage, and requirement fulfillment through comprehensive code review and testing validation.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/code-reviewer.md](./.claude/skills/code-reviewer.md)

### 11. Documentation Scribe
- **Role:** Creates and maintains comprehensive documentation including API references, user guides, architecture docs, and code comments.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/documentation-scribe.md](./.claude/skills/documentation-scribe.md)

# Hearthlink Agent Team Manifest

This document defines the structure of the specialized AI agent team for the Hearthlink project. Each agent has a distinct role and is configured with a specific skill prompt from the `.claude/skills/` directory.

## Core Development Team

### 1. Specifications Planner
- **Role:** Gathers requirements, defines project scope, and produces detailed technical specifications (PRDs).

### 2. System Architect
- **Role:** Designs the overall system architecture, including security, performance, and database structure.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/system-architect.md](./.claude/skills/system-architect.md)

### 3. Agent Architect
- **Role:** Specializes in the design of the multi-agent ecosystem, communication, and coordination.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/agent-architect.md](./.claude/skills/agent-architect.md)

### 4. Frontend Developer
- **Role:** Implements the UI/UX in React/TypeScript, focusing on accessibility and performance.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-frontend-dev.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-frontend-dev.md)

### 5. Backend Developer
- **Role:** Implements the core services and IPC architecture in Rust/Tauri.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-backend-dev.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-backend-dev.md)

## Specialist & Support Roles

### 6. UI/UX Design Specialist
- **Role:** Focuses on visual design, motion, and creating polished, intuitive interfaces.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-ui-ux-designer.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-ui-ux-designer.md)

### 7. DevOps Engineer
- **Role:** Manages CI/CD pipelines, build automation, and infrastructure.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/devops-engineer.md](./.claude/skills/devops-engineer.md)

### 8. Accessibility Specialist
- **Role:** Audits for WCAG compliance and ensures the application is inclusive.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/accessibility-specialist.md](./.claude/skills/accessibility-specialist.md)

### 9. Voice Integration Specialist
- **Role:** Designs and implements voice interfaces, speech recognition, and TTS.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/voice-integration-specialist.md](./.claude/skills/voice-integration-specialist.md)

### 10. Quality Validator (Code Reviewer)
- **Role:** Ensures code quality, test coverage, and requirement fulfillment through comprehensive code review and testing validation.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/code-reviewer.md](./.claude/skills/code-reviewer.md)

### 11. Documentation Scribe
- **Role:** Creates and maintains comprehensive documentation including API references, user guides, architecture docs, and code comments.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/documentation-scribe.md](./.claude/skills/documentation-scribe.md)
</INSTRUCTIONS>

issues.jsonl:3:{"title":"Local voice loop","body":"## Summary
- Implement the end-to-end local voice subsystem combining Whisper speech-to-text and Piper text-to-speech.
- Surface microphone permission prompts, latency tracking, and a basic voice control panel UI.
- Ensure persona routing for voice commands integrates with the broader event system.

## Tasks
- [ ] Package Whisper and Piper runtimes for local execution within the Tauri environment.
- [ ] Build voiceService managing audio capture, transcription, synthesis, and error fallbacks.
- [ ] Design voice UI with recording indicators, command history, and persona selector.
- [ ] Track round-trip latency metrics and surface them to diagnostics logs.
- [ ] Provide automated tests simulating transcription and playback flows.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Users can trigger push-to-talk or always-on modes with accurate STT and responsive TTS.
- Voice commands route to the active persona and log actions in collaboration history.
- Latency metrics remain within documented thresholds and regressions trigger CI alerts.
","labels":["alpha","voice","uiux"],"milestone":"P3 – Voice"}

payload.text:
**Verifying and aligning chat history method**

I’m double-checking the `getChatHistory` method to make sure it’s correctly added and aligned with instructions, especially using `user_id` consistently in requests. I’m also confirming that `getMockResponse` handles the `alden_chat_history_get` command properly and thinking about running Rust checks next to validate the backend. Then I’ll look into voice UI components since they might need new backend support.

summary.text:
**Verifying and aligning chat history method**

I’m double-checking the `getChatHistory` method to make sure it’s correctly added and aligned with instructions, especially using `user_id` consistently in requests. I’m also confirming that `getMockResponse` handles the `alden_chat_history_get` command properly and thinking about running Rust checks next to validate the backend. Then I’ll look into voice UI components since they might need new backend support.

*Detailed Task Breakdown for Frontend Implementation*

## Development Sprint Organization

**Total Timeline**: 6 weeks (30 development days)
**Sprint Structure**: 6 x 1-week sprints with clear deliverables
**Priority**: Critical path items first, then supporting features

---

## 🏃‍♂️ Sprint 1 (Week 1): Alden Interface Foundation

### **Sprint Goal**: Functional Alden chat interface with Tauri IPC integration

#### **Day 1-2: Core Chat Components**
```typescript
// Priority: CRITICAL
Tasks:
1. AldenChat container component
2. MessageList display component
3. MessageInput with basic validation
4. Tauri IPC integration setup

Files to Create:
- src/components/modules/AldenInterface/AldenChat/ChatContainer.tsx
- src/components/modules/AldenInterface/AldenChat/MessageList.tsx
- src/components/modules/AldenInterface/AldenChat/MessageInput.tsx
- src/lib/tauri-commands.ts
- src/store/modules/alden-store.ts

Expected Outcome: Basic chat interface that can send/receive messages via Tauri IPC
```

#### **Day 3-4: Session Management**
```typescript
// Priority: HIGH
Tasks:
1. Session creation workflow
2. Session browser interface
3. Session persistence handling
4. Session state management

Files to Create:
- src/components/modules/AldenInterface/AldenSessions/SessionManager.tsx
- src/components/modules/AldenInterface/AldenSessions/SessionList.tsx
- src/hooks/useAldenSession.ts

Expected Outcome: Users can create, switch between, and manage conversation sessions
```

#### **Day 5: Voice Integration Prep**
```typescript
// Priority: MEDIUM
Tasks:
1. Voice input component structure
2. Voice indicator visualization
3. Audio permission handling
4. Voice-to-text integration prep

Files to Create:
- src/components/modules/AldenInterface/AldenChat/VoiceIndicator.tsx
- src/hooks/useVoiceInput.ts

Expected Outcome: UI ready for voice input integration
```

#### **Sprint 1 Deliverables**:
- ✅ Functional Alden chat interface
- ✅ Session creation and management
- ✅ Tauri IPC message sending/receiving
- ✅ Basic state management for conversations

---

## 🏃‍♂️ Sprint 2 (Week 2): Core Orchestration Interface

### **Sprint Goal**: Multi-agent session coordination interface

#### **Day 6-7: Session Creation Wizard**
```typescript
// Priority: CRITICAL
Tasks:
1. Multi-agent session setup form
2. Agent selection interface
3. Session configuration options
4. Session template system

Files to Create:
- src/components/modules/CoreInterface/SessionOrchestration/SessionCreator.tsx
- src/components/modules/CoreInterface/SessionOrchestration/AgentManager.tsx
- src/store/modules/core-store.ts

Expected Outcome: Users can create coordinated multi-agent sessions
```

#### **Day 8-9: Real-time Session Monitoring**
```typescript
// Priority: HIGH
Tasks:
1. Active session dashboard
2. Turn-taking visualization
3. Agent status indicators
4. Real-time updates via polling

Files to Create:
- src/components/modules/CoreInterface/MultiAgentDashboard/AgentStatus.tsx
- src/components/modules/CoreInterface/MultiAgentDashboard/ConversationFlow.tsx
- src/hooks/useSessionStatus.ts

Expected Outcome: Real-time visibility into multi-agent session state
```

#### **Day 10: Session History and Analytics**
```typescript
// Priority: MEDIUM
Tasks:
1. Session history browser
2. Session performance metrics
3. Conversation analytics
4. Export functionality

Files to Create:
- src/components/modules/CoreInterface/SessionManagement/SessionHistory.tsx
- src/components/modules/CoreInterface/MultiAgentDashboard/SessionMetrics.tsx

Expected Outcome: Historical session data and performance insights
```

#### **Sprint 2 Deliverables**:
- ✅ Multi-agent session creation
- ✅ Real-time session monitoring
- ✅ Turn-taking coordination
- ✅ Session history and analytics

---

## 🏃‍♂️ Sprint 3 (Week 3): Vault Interface Development

### **Sprint Goal**: Complete memory management interface

#### **Day 11-12: Memory Browser**
```typescript
// Priority: HIGH
Tasks:
1. Hierarchical memory navigation
2. Memory content viewer
3. Memory search interface
4. Memory categorization/tagging

Files to Create:
- src/components/modules/VaultInterface/MemoryExplorer/MemoryBrowser.tsx
```

use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
use sqlx::FromRow;
use crate::utils::datetime_serde;

// ============================================================================
// Task Management Models
// ============================================================================

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize, FromRow)]
pub struct Task {
    pub id: String,
    pub user_id: String,
    pub title: String,
    pub description: Option<String>,
    pub status: String,   // "pending", "in_progress", "completed", "archived"
    pub priority: String, // "low", "medium", "high", "urgent"
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_optional_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_optional_timestamp"
    )]
    pub due_date: Option<i64>,
    pub parent_task_id: Option<String>,
    pub tags: Option<String>, // JSON array stored as string
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub created_at: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub updated_at: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_optional_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_optional_timestamp"
    )]
    pub completed_at: Option<i64>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct CreateTaskRequest {
    pub user_id: String,
    pub title: String,
    pub description: Option<String>,
    pub priority: Option<String>,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_optional_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_optional_timestamp"
    )]
    pub due_date: Option<i64>,
    pub tags: Option<Vec<String>>,
    pub natural_language: Option<String>, // For NLP parsing
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct UpdateTaskRequest {
    pub title: Option<String>,
    pub description: Option<String>,
    pub status: Option<String>,
    pub priority: Option<String>,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_optional_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_optional_timestamp"
    )]
    pub due_date: Option<i64>,
    pub tags: Option<Vec<String>>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct TaskFilter {
    pub status: Option<Vec<String>>,
    pub priority: Option<Vec<String>>,
    pub tags: Option<Vec<String>>,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_optional_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_optional_timestamp"
    )]
    pub due_before: Option<i64>,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_optional_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_optional_timestamp"
    )]
    pub due_after: Option<i64>,
    pub parent_task_id: Option<String>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct TaskAnalytics {
    pub total_tasks: i64,
    pub completed_tasks: i64,
    pub pending_tasks: i64,
    pub in_progress_tasks: i64,
    pub overdue_tasks: i64,
    pub completion_rate: f64,
    pub avg_completion_time_hours: Option<f64>,
    pub tasks_by_priority: serde_json::Value,
    pub tasks_by_tag: serde_json::Value,
}

// ============================================================================
// Calendar Management Models
// ============================================================================

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize, FromRow)]
pub struct CalendarEvent {
    pub id: String,
    pub user_id: String,
    pub title: String,
    pub description: Option<String>,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub start_time: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub end_time: i64,
    pub location: Option<String>,
    pub attendees: Option<String>, // JSON array
    pub calendar_id: String,
    pub event_type: String, // "meeting", "task", "reminder", "block"
    pub recurrence_rule: Option<String>, // RFC 5545 RRULE format
    pub reminder_minutes: Option<i64>,
    pub is_all_day: bool,
    pub external_id: Option<String>, // For synced events
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub created_at: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub updated_at: i64,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct CreateEventRequest {
    pub user_id: String,
    pub title: String,
    pub description: Option<String>,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub start_time: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub end_time: i64,
    pub location: Option<String>,
    pub attendees: Option<Vec<String>>,
    pub calendar_id: String,
    pub event_type: Option<String>,
    pub recurrence_rule: Option<String>,
    pub reminder_minutes: Option<i64>,
    pub is_all_day: Option<bool>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct AvailabilityRequest {
    pub user_id: String,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub start_time: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub end_time: i64,
    pub duration_minutes: i64,
    pub calendar_ids: Option<Vec<String>>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct AvailabilitySlot {
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub start_time: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub end_time: i64,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct ProviderSyncRequest {
    #[serde(rename = "userId", alias = "user_id")]
    pub user_id: String,
    #[serde(rename = "calendarId", alias = "calendar_id")]
    pub calendar_id: Option<String>,
    #[serde(rename = "accessToken", alias = "access_token")]
    pub access_token: Option<String>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct CalendarSyncResult {
    pub provider: String,
    pub status: String,
    #[serde(rename = "eventsSynced")]
    pub events_synced: usize,
    #[serde(rename = "lastSyncAt")]
    pub last_sync_at: String,
    pub error: Option<String>,
}

// ============================================================================
// Email Management Models
// ============================================================================

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct EmailAccount {
    pub id: String,
    pub user_id: String,
    pub email_address: String,
    pub provider: String, // "gmail", "outlook", "imap", "pop3"
    pub display_name: String,
    pub server_host: Option<String>,
    pub server_port: Option<i32>,
    pub use_ssl: bool,
    // Note: encrypted_credentials not included in public API for security
    pub is_active: bool,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_optional_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_optional_timestamp"
    )]
    pub last_sync: Option<i64>,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub created_at: i64,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize, FromRow)]
pub struct EmailMessage {
    pub id: String,
    pub account_id: String,
    pub user_id: String,
    pub message_id: String, // External message ID
    pub from_address: String,
    pub to_addresses: String,         // JSON array
    pub cc_addresses: Option<String>, // JSON array
    pub subject: String,
    pub body_plain: Option<String>,
    pub body_html: Option<String>,
    pub is_read: bool,
    pub is_starred: bool,
    pub folder: String,         // "inbox", "sent", "archive", "trash"
    pub labels: Option<String>, // JSON array
    pub has_attachments: bool,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub received_at: i64,
    #[serde(
        serialize_with = "datetime_serde::serialize_timestamp",
        deserialize_with = "datetime_serde::deserialize_timestamp"
    )]
    pub created_at: i64,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct SendEmailRequest {
    pub account_id: String,
    pub user_id: String,
    pub to_addresses: Vec<String>,
    pub cc_addresses: Option<Vec<String>>,
    pub bcc_addresses: Option<Vec<String>>,
    pub subject: String,
    pub body_plain: Option<String>,
    pub body_html: Option<String>,
    pub attachments: Option<Vec<EmailAttachment>>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct EmailAttachment {
    pub filename: String,
    pub content_type: String,
    pub data: Vec<u8>,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct EmailToTaskRequest {
    pub message_id: String,
    pub user_id: String,
    pub extract_metadata: bool,
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize, FromRow)]
pub struct EmailTemplate {
    pub id: String,
    pub user_id: String,
    pub name: String,
    pub subject: String,
    pub body: String,
    pub category: Option<String>,
}

payload.text:
**Verifying timestamp serde and Synapse tests**

I'm checking that all timestamp fields have proper serde attributes, especially with potential renaming or converting types like in `CalendarSyncResult`. Then I want to focus on validating the Synapse refactor by inspecting `src-tauri` for the Synapse module, its tests, and the correct cargo test commands to run, including checking `Cargo.toml` for package details. I'll also consider the scope of voice STT/TTS features, leaning toward front-end handling for now.

payload.text: **Designing and integrating a voice input hook**

**Coordinating voice hook with message sending and UI updates**

I'm organizing the interplay between the voice input hook and message sending logic to avoid circular dependencies. I'll handle final transcripts by tracking a sequence number to trigger sends exactly once per result. I'll separate text-to-speech calls into a `useEffect` that reacts to new responses, keeping `sendMessage` focused. The UI will reflect voice support, listening state, and transcript display, managing button states accordingly. This approach keeps the flow clean, stabilizes callbacks, and improves user feedback.

summary.text: **Designing and integrating a voice input hook**

**Coordinating voice hook with message sending and UI updates**

I'm organizing the interplay between the voice input hook and message sending logic to avoid circular dependencies. I'll handle final transcripts by tracking a sequence number to trigger sends exactly once per result. I'll separate text-to-speech calls into a `useEffect` that reacts to new responses, keeping `sendMessage` focused. The UI will reflect voice support, listening state, and transcript display, managing button states accordingly. This approach keeps the flow clean, stabilizes callbacks, and improves user feedback.

payload.text:
**Implementing speech synthesis support and error handling**

I’m working on adding a stateful check for text-to-speech support using a `useEffect` hook to detect `speechSynthesis` availability safely, avoiding server or test environment issues. This lets me update UI dynamically, show helpful messages, and decide whether to enable or disable TTS controls without breaking tests that run in JSDOM. I’m also planning the voice input hook enhancements, including robust error handling and stable start/stop functions, while carefully managing imports and relative paths for the new hook integration.

**Integrating voice input hook with chat screen state and effects**

I’m updating the chat screen’s state to incorporate the new `useVoiceInput` hook, removing the old mic state and adding robust handling for voice transcripts, sending messages triggered by voice input, and syncing text-to-speech. This includes managing dependencies carefully in effects, updating UI hints, and planning the creation of the hook file itself.

**Rewriting message handling functions and voice input hooks**

I also need to refactor the voice input hook call to destructure only the necessary state and functions from `useVoiceInput`, updating all related effects and handlers to use these destructured values instead of the entire object. This will improve dependency management and make voice-related features like TTS support and transcript handling cleaner and more reliable.

payload.text:
**Correcting TypeScript typings for SpeechRecognition**

I’m resolving type conflicts by renaming the SpeechRecognition interface to SpeechRecognitionInstance and introducing a SpeechRecognitionConstructor interface for the constructor. To avoid complex conflicts with existing DOM typings, I’ll simplify by declaring SpeechRecognition and related event types as any and adjusting all related references and typings in the `useVoiceInput` hook accordingly. This keeps the code compiling without redefining built-in types.

# AGENTS.md instructions for g:\MythologIQ\Hearthlink

<INSTRUCTIONS>
# Hearthlink Agent Team Manifest

This document defines the structure of the specialized AI agent team for the Hearthlink project. Each agent has a distinct role and is configured with a specific skill prompt from the `.claude/skills/` directory.

## Core Development Team

### 1. Specifications Planner
- **Role:** Gathers requirements, defines project scope, and produces detailed technical specifications (PRDs).
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/project-planner.md](./.claude/skills/project-planner.md)

### 2. System Architect
- **Role:** Designs the overall system architecture, including security, performance, and database structure.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/system-architect.md](./.claude/skills/system-architect.md)

### 3. Agent Architect
- **Role:** Specializes in the design of the multi-agent ecosystem, communication, and coordination.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/agent-architect.md](./.claude/skills/agent-architect.md)

### 4. Frontend Developer
- **Role:** Implements the UI/UX in React/TypeScript, focusing on accessibility and performance.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-frontend-dev.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-frontend-dev.md)

### 5. Backend Developer
- **Role:** Implements the core services and IPC architecture in Rust/Tauri.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-backend-dev.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-backend-dev.md)

## Specialist & Support Roles

### 6. UI/UX Design Specialist
- **Role:** Focuses on visual design, motion, and creating polished, intuitive interfaces.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/hearthlink-ui-ux-designer.md](./.claude/skills/hearthlink-ui-ux-designer.md)

### 7. DevOps Engineer
- **Role:** Manages CI/CD pipelines, build automation, and infrastructure.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/devops-engineer.md](./.claude/skills/devops-engineer.md)

### 8. Accessibility Specialist
- **Role:** Audits for WCAG compliance and ensures the application is inclusive.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/accessibility-specialist.md](./.claude/skills/accessibility-specialist.md)

### 9. Voice Integration Specialist
- **Role:** Designs and implements voice interfaces, speech recognition, and TTS.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/voice-integration-specialist.md](./.claude/skills/voice-integration-specialist.md)

### 10. Quality Validator (Code Reviewer)
- **Role:** Ensures code quality, test coverage, and requirement fulfillment through comprehensive code review and testing validation.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/code-reviewer.md](./.claude/skills/code-reviewer.md)

### 11. Documentation Scribe
- **Role:** Creates and maintains comprehensive documentation including API references, user guides, architecture docs, and code comments.
- **Skill File:** [.claude/skills/documentation-scribe.md](./.claude/skills/documentation-scribe.md)
</INSTRUCTIONS>

payload.text:
**Reviewing Codex backend tasks and checks**

I'm mapping out key tasks like verifying the Synapse refactor by running tests, ensuring the new Voice UI logic (STT/TTS handlers) is present, and finalizing alden_chat_history_get and datetime_serde. Since the previous agent might have done some of this, I want to confirm by inspecting relevant files and rerunning build and test commands like `npm run compile:ts` and `cargo test synapse` to ensure everything is solid and up to date.

payload.text:
**Summarizing final test verification and feature references**

I'm putting together a clear bullet list summarizing how the voice UI uses `useVoiceInput` and connects to `AldenChatScreen` with multiple specific file line references, highlighting backend bridging in `AldenBridge` and the `datetime_serde` helpers likewise, plus noting that all relevant tests (`npm run compile:ts`, `cargo test synapse`, `cargo test datetime_serde`) were rerun with known warnings. I plan to close by suggesting natural next steps like manual UI testing and replacing mock STT/TTS providers, sticking closely to instruction formatting and standalone path references.

payload.message:
Voice features are fully wired: the new `useVoiceInput` hook now wraps the browser speech APIs (start/stop listening, interim vs final transcripts, STT error handling, and text‑to‑speech playback) so the UI can reuse a single source of truth for mic state and spoken replies (`src/hooks/useVoiceInput.ts:50`, `src/hooks/useVoiceInput.ts:142`, `src/hooks/useVoiceInput.ts:175`), and `AldenChatScreen` consumes that hook to toggle the mic button, auto-send transcripts, and mute/unmute TTS per the user’s preference (`src/components/alden/AldenChatScreen.tsx:85`, `src/components/alden/AldenChatScreen.tsx:251`, `src/components/alden/AldenChatScreen.tsx:311`).

Backend handshake is complete for chat history and datetime serialization: `AldenBridge.getChatHistory` now invokes the `alden_chat_history_get` command consistently so the frontend and backend share the same alias, and `datetime_serde` keeps converting between ISO strings and internal `i64` timestamps (plus the UTC-based tests) to uphold the data contract (`src/bridges/AldenBridge.ts:873`, `src-tauri/src/utils/datetime_serde.rs:38`, `src-tauri/src/utils/datetime_serde.rs:139`).

Testing: `npm run compile:ts`, `cargo test synapse`, and `cargo test datetime_serde` all succeed; Cargo still reports the longstanding cache-clean/access warnings and the usual unused-code/deprecated warnings in the synapse crate but no failures.

Next steps:
1. Manually exercise the voice controls in the browser build to make sure mic toggling, auto-send, and TTS behave as expected.
2. Hook the STT and TTS flows to real providers (or mocks with richer data) so the UI can rely on production speech models.

summary.text:
**Summarizing final test verification and feature references**

I'm putting together a clear bullet list summarizing how the voice UI uses `useVoiceInput` and connects to `AldenChatScreen` with multiple specific file line references, highlighting backend bridging in `AldenBridge` and the `datetime_serde` helpers likewise, plus noting that all relevant tests (`npm run compile:ts`, `cargo test synapse`, `cargo test datetime_serde`) were rerun with known warnings. I plan to close by suggesting natural next steps like manual UI testing and replacing mock STT/TTS providers, sticking closely to instruction formatting and standalone path references.

content.text:
Voice features are fully wired: the new `useVoiceInput` hook now wraps the browser speech APIs (start/stop listening, interim vs final transcripts, STT error handling, and text‑to‑speech playback) so the UI can reuse a single source of truth for mic state and spoken replies (`src/hooks/useVoiceInput.ts:50`, `src/hooks/useVoiceInput.ts:142`, `src/hooks/useVoiceInput.ts:175`), and `AldenChatScreen` consumes that hook to toggle the mic button, auto-send transcripts, and mute/unmute TTS per the user’s preference (`src/components/alden/AldenChatScreen.tsx:85`, `src/components/alden/AldenChatScreen.tsx:251`, `src/components/alden/AldenChatScreen.tsx:311`).

Backend handshake is complete for chat history and datetime serialization: `AldenBridge.getChatHistory` now invokes the `alden_chat_history_get` command consistently so the frontend and backend share the same alias, and `datetime_serde` keeps converting between ISO strings and internal `i64` timestamps (plus the UTC-based tests) to uphold the data contract (`src/bridges/AldenBridge.ts:873`, `src-tauri/src/utils/datetime_serde.rs:38`, `src-tauri/src/utils/datetime_serde.rs:139`).

Testing: `npm run compile:ts`, `cargo test synapse`, and `cargo test datetime_serde` all succeed; Cargo still reports the longstanding cache-clean/access warnings and the usual unused-code/deprecated warnings in the synapse crate but no failures.

Next steps:
1. Manually exercise the voice controls in the browser build to make sure mic toggling, auto-send, and TTS behave as expected.
2. Hook the STT and TTS flows to real providers (or mocks with richer data) so the UI can rely on production speech models.
